de.topicmapslab.tmql4j.components.parser
Interface IParserTree

All Known Implementing Classes:
ParserTreeImpl, TmqlParserTree, TmqlParserTree
public interface IParserTree

Interface definition of a parser tree. The parser tree is a tree-structured representation of the origin query. Each node of the tree represent exactly one production rule of the current TMQL draft. A node can have a non-quantified number of children representing the current node in the aggregate. Nodes of the same level never overlapping and cannot contain the same tokens at the same time.

Author:
Sven Krosse

Method Summary
 IQuery getQuery()
          Method returns the internal copy of the origin query represented by this tree-structure.
 IExpression root()
          Method returns the IExpression representing the root node of the generated parsing tree.
 void toStringTree(java.lang.StringBuilder builder)
          Method transform the tree-structure to a string and write them into the given string builder.
 

Method Detail

root

IExpression root()
Method returns the IExpression representing the root node of the generated parsing tree. The expression has to be of type query-expression and the result of calling the method IExpression.getParent() has to be null.

Returns:
the root node

getQuery

IQuery getQuery()
Method returns the internal copy of the origin query represented by this tree-structure.

Returns:
the query instance

toStringTree

void toStringTree(java.lang.StringBuilder builder)
Method transform the tree-structure to a string and write them into the given string builder.

Parameters:
builder - the string builder where the generated string will be written in
